alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 4:23PM MDT until June 14 at 3:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton WY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River at Riverton affecting Fremont County. Wind River near Kinnear affecting Fremont County. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Crowheart affecting Fremont County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt high mountain snowpack today, with high volumes of snowmelt moving through area rivers and streams over the coming two to three days. Expect high flows at least through the middle of the week. For the Wind River Basin...including Dubois, Crowheart, Kinnear, Riverton...Minor to Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wind River near Kinnear. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor agricultural flooding along right bank. Water begins to move towards low areas north of Highway 132. At 9.0 feet, Flood stage. Agricultural flooding along both banks becomes more widespread and intensifies. Water begins to encroach the north end of Highway 132. At 9.9 feet, Record stage and flow---16,600 cfs (7/1/2011). * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to minor flood stage with a maximum value of 9.0 feet this evening into the overnight. It will remain near minor flood stage until Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when near riverbanks.
